title: Olympic Champion Mo Farah Says He Was Trafficked to U.K. as a Child
abstract: Farah, an accomplished distance runner, made the revelation in an upcoming documentary, saying it could put his citizenship at risk.

multimedia.caption: In 2016, Mo Farah became the first man in 40 years to win gold medals in the 5,000- and 10,000-meter races in two separate Olympic Games. He was knighted a year later.
multimedia.copyright: James Hill for The New York Times

title: Its Rivals Filled the Nets. England Showed It Can, Too.
abstract: A meeting of equally regarded teams ended with an 8-0 England victory and arguably the most surprising result of the women’s Euros.

title: PGA Tour’s Fight With LIV Golf Reaches Justice Department
abstract: The Justice Department is investigating the PGA Tour for anticompetitive behavior in its dealings with the breakaway LIV Golf series.

multimedia.caption: Members of the 4 Aces G.C. and their caddies celebrated their team win this month at an LIV Golf series event in Oregon.

title: One Golfer Not Welcome at the British Open? Greg Norman.
abstract: Norman’s only major tournament victories came in Opens, but his role leading the Saudi-financed LIV Golf series has caused a rift with the R&A.

multimedia.caption: Greg Norman's involvement with the LIV Golf series has put him at odds with other golf figures.
Greg Norman's involvement with the LIV Golf series has put him at odds with other golf figures.

title: Rail Strife Shadows Plans for Record British Open Crowd
abstract: About 290,000 fans are expected at St. Andrews for this year’s tournament. Whether they will be able to get there by train is a different matter.

title: Gary Player Fears for the Old Course (and Probably Your Breakfast Order)
abstract: Player, who won nine majors during his celebrated career, talked with The Times ahead of the British Open, his favorite top-tier tournament of all.

title: In Spite of Pitching Woes, the Red Sox Keep Swinging
abstract: Injuries have hampered the team’s already fragile rotation, but a powerful offense has kept Boston in the postseason hunt.

title: Contreras Brothers Join a Rare Fraternity as All-Star Starters
abstract: The National League’s starting catcher (Willson) and designated hitter (William) will join four other sets of brothers who have started an M.L.B. All-Star Game together.

multimedia.caption: Willson Contreras was elected as the National League's starting catcher in this year's All-Star Game. His brother William will start for the N.L. at designated hitter.

title: Denver Broncos Add Condoleezza Rice to Ownership Group
abstract: Rice is the second Black woman to join the team’s new ownership group, alongside Mellody Hobson.

multimedia.caption: Condoleezza Rice’s addition comes amid a push by the N.F.L. to increase the diversity of the league’s highest ranks.

title: Built to Be Flexible, Novak Djokovic Bounces Back
abstract: After forgoing a Covid-19 vaccine complicated his schedule, Djokovic’s elasticity this year has gone beyond the reactive shots that helped him win a seventh Wimbledon men’s singles title.

multimedia.caption: Novak Djokovic won Wimbledon after missing the first Grand Slam tournament of the year and losing in the quarterfinals at the French Open.
Novak Djokovic won Wimbledon after missing the first Grand Slam tournament of the year and losing in the quarterfinals at the French Open.

title: Inside Brazil’s 40-Year Rise to Global Surfing Dominance
abstract: This generation of Brazilian surfers is so dominant, so undeniable, that it has earned a nickname: the Brazilian Storm.

title: Fans Love W.N.B.A. All-Stars, but Cast a Critical Eye on the League
abstract: Fans who traveled to Chicago to celebrate their favorite players called for the W.N.B.A. to improve. The players did, too.

multimedia.caption: Team Wilson beat Team Stewart in the W.N.B.A. All-Star Game on Sunday. Las Vegas Aces forward A’ja Wilson, second from right, and Minnesota Lynx center Sylvia Fowles, second from left, were the team’s captains.

title: Mets and Yankees Sending 10 Players to All-Star Game
abstract: Pete Alonso makes his return to the Midsummer Classic (and the Home Run Derby) and he will be joined by three teammates and six Yankees players.

title: Novak Djokovic Defeats Nick Kyrgios to Win His Seventh Wimbledon Title
abstract: Djokovic dropped the first set of the men’s singles final, but won the next three to capture his 21st Grand Slam title.

multimedia.caption: Novak Djokovic of Serbia has won the Wimbledon men’s singles title four times in a row.

title: Wimbledon Needs More Arthur Ashe Moments, On and Off the Court
abstract: Nick Kyrgios and Ons Jabeur brought a fresh diversity to the men’s and women’s singles finals.

title: The Most Talented Runner of His Generation Takes the Unexpected Route Back Home
abstract: Forty-four years ago, Henry Rono set multiple world records on the track. Much of his life was later overshadowed by addiction. But at 70, he has no regrets.

multimedia.caption: Henry Rono, 70, stood outside his brother’s home on the property where he grew up in Nandi County, Kenya.
Henry Rono, 70, stood outside his brother’s home on the property where he grew up in Nandi County, Kenya.
Henry Rono, 70, stood outside his brother’s home on the property where he grew up in Nandi County, Kenya.

title: Tennis Is Done With Covid-19, but the Virus Isn’t Done With Tennis
abstract: With testing, quarantine and isolation requirements all but gone, tennis finally seems to have entered a stage of pandemic apathy, much like a lot of society.

multimedia.caption: Wimbledon will likely be Novak Djokovic’s last Grand Slam tournament this year because of coronavirus-related restrictions in the United States.
Wimbledon will likely be Novak Djokovic’s last Grand Slam tournament this year because of coronavirus-related restrictions in the United States.

abstract: Djokovic, a six-time Wimbledon champion, plays Nick Kyrgios, who is appearing in his first Grand Slam singles final.

title: Mike Brito, Influential Dodger Scout in Mexico, Dies at 87
abstract: He opened the door to the major leagues for many Mexican players, most notably Fernando Valenzuela, who won the 1981 Rookie of the Year and Cy Young Awards.

multimedia.caption: Mike Brito throwing out the first pitch at a game in 2016. He was a longtime scout for the Dodgers, signing about 32 players, mostly from Mexico, who reached the major leagues.
Mike Brito throwing out the first pitch at a game in 2016. He was a longtime scout for the Dodgers, signing about 32 players, mostly from Mexico, who reached the major leagues.
Mike Brito throwing out the first pitch at a game in 2016. He was a longtime scout for the Dodgers, signing about 32 players, mostly from Mexico, who reached the major leagues.

title: With a Wimbledon Title, Elena Rybakina Finally Cracks a Smile
abstract: Rybakina’s victory at Wimbledon was deeply impressive but not the outcome that most in Centre Court or on the payrolls of the All England Club were yearning for.

multimedia.caption: Elena Rybakina defeated Ons Jabeur, 3-6, 6-2, 6-2, in the Wimbledon women’s singles final.

title: Jake Paul Is Aiming for Boxing Legitimacy, and Collecting Seashells
abstract: The social media star is preparing to fight his first opponent with professional boxing experience: Hasim Rahman Jr., who is 12-1. “I’ve been waiting to take his head off,” Paul said in an interview.

multimedia.caption: Jake Paul will face the biggest test of his boxing career next month. He said eating candy beforehand might help.
Jake Paul will face the biggest test of his boxing career next month. He said eating candy beforehand might help.

title: Hank Goldberg, Betting Maven and Sports Radio Star, Dies at 82
abstract: A New Jersey fan of sports and gambling who became one of the country’s top television handicappers: What are the odds?

multimedia.caption: Hank Goldberg, oddsmaker extraordinaire, at the 2007 Breeders’ Cup in Monmouth, N.J. He built a following on sports radio in Miami before moving to ESPN.

title: Elena Rybakina Wins Wimbledon and Her First Grand Slam Title
abstract: Rybakina, who was born and raised in Russia, started representing Kazakhstan after the Russian tennis federation gave up on her. She beat Ons Jabeur in three sets to win the women’s singles title.

multimedia.caption: This was Rybakina’s first Grand Slam title and the first for a singles player representing Kazakhstan.
This was Rybakina’s first Grand Slam title and the first for a singles player representing Kazakhstan.

title: ‘The Sinker Is Going to Be My Ticket’
abstract: Clay Holmes knew what made him special as a pitcher. It took some time — and a trade to the Yankees — for that vision to become reality.

title: Judge and Stanton Will Start for A.L. in All-Star Game
abstract: The Yankees sluggers will join Mike Trout of the Angels in the American League’s starting outfield.

title: For Sunday’s Wimbledon Final, ‘Fireworks’ and a Contrast in Style
abstract: Despite their previously contentious relationship, Nick Kyrgios and Novak Djokovic have developed “a bit of a bromance,” Kyrgios said. They meet for the Wimbledon men’s singles title on Sunday.

multimedia.caption: Sunday will be Novak Djokovic’s 32nd appearance in a Grand Slam singles final, a record.

abstract: Elena Rybakina was born and raised in Russia but started representing Kazakhstan after the Russian Tennis Federation gave up on her. Does she see herself as Russian? “It’s a tough question.”

abstract: Young, set to start in her first W.N.B.A. All-Star Game, is known for her competitive drive. “She’s going to try to beat everyone,” one teammate said.

title: Glimpses of Brittney Griner Show a Complicated Path to Release
abstract: The W.N.B.A. star’s appearances this week during her trial on drug charges in Russia highlighted the unclear path to her release and heightened her supporters’ concerns for her safety.

title: Sepp Blatter and Michel Platini Acquitted of Fraud
abstract: Blatter, the former president of FIFA, world soccer’s governing body, and Platini, his onetime ally, were charged over a $2 million payment that prosecutors had labeled a bribe.

multimedia.caption: Sepp Blatter was accused of fraud, criminal mismanagement and forgery by Swiss prosecutors.
Sepp Blatter was accused of fraud, criminal mismanagement and forgery by Swiss prosecutors.

title: What happens next for Brittney Griner?
abstract: The American basketball star still faces the conviction and sentencing phases of her trial in Russia. But experts say her best hope may be a diplomatic deal between the U.S. and Russia.
byline: By Anton Troianovski, Ivan Nechepurenko, Tania Ganguli and Dan Bilefsky

abstract: Montreal hosted the event and chose first, delivering the initial surprise of a top five full of them.

title: Brittney Griner’s Supporters Hold Steady After Guilty Plea
abstract: Griner, the W.N.B.A. star, pleaded guilty to drug charges in Russia on Thursday. But her supporters are still determined to fight to bring her home.

multimedia.caption: Cherelle Griner at a rally for her wife, Brittney Griner, on Wednesday in Phoenix. Brittney Griner has been detained in Russia on drug charges since February.

title: Ons Jabeur, an Entertainer Who May Soon Be a Wimbledon Champion
abstract: Jabeur, the first Arab or African woman to reach a Grand Slam singles final in the Open era, will face Elena Rybakina in Saturday’s women’s final.

multimedia.caption: Ons Jabeur winning a point against Tatjana Maria in their women's singles semifinal match Thursday.

title: Raiders Make N.F.L. History With Team President Hire
abstract: Reeling from scandal and the exodus of team executives, the Las Vegas Raiders hired Sandra Douglass Morgan as their president. She is the first Black woman to hold the role in N.F.L. history.

multimedia.caption: Sandra Douglass Morgan, the former chairwoman of the Nevada Gaming Control Board, was hired by the Las Vegas Raiders as the team’s president.
Sandra Douglass Morgan, the former chairwoman of the Nevada Gaming Control Board, was hired by the Las Vegas Raiders as the team’s president.
